longDef.en: When you play, especially as a child, you spend time doing an enjoyable and/or entertaining activity.

examples.en: The children spent the afternoon playing with their new toys.
examples.cn: 孩子们下午在玩自己的新玩具。

examples.en: My daughter used to play with the kids next door.
examples.cn: 我女儿过去常跟隔壁的孩子们玩。

longDef.en: to take part in a game or other organized activity

examples.en: Do you want to play cards/football (with us)?
examples.cn: 你想（和我们）打牌／踢球吗？

examples.en: Irene won't be able to play in the tennis match on Saturday.
examples.cn: 艾琳星期六不能参加网球比赛。

examples.en: Which team do you play for?
examples.cn: 你为哪支球队效力？

examples.en: Luke plays centre-forward (= plays in that position within the team).
examples.cn: 卢克踢中锋。

longDef.en: to compete against a person or team in a game

examples.en: Who are the Giants playing next week?
examples.cn: 下星期巨人队和哪个队比赛？

longDef.en: to hit or kick a ball in a game

examples.en: He played the ball back to the goalkeeper.
examples.cn: 他把球踢回给守门员。

examples.en: A good pool player takes time deciding which shot to play.
examples.cn: 一个优秀的台球选手会从容考虑击哪个球。

longDef.en: (in a card game) to choose a card from the ones you are holding and put it down on the table

examples.en: She played the ace of spades.
examples.cn: 她出了一张黑桃 A。

longDef.en: to perform an entertainment or a particular character in a play, film, etc.

examples.en: Scottish Opera played to full houses every night.
examples.cn: 苏格兰歌剧院每晚演出都爆满。

examples.en: I didn't realize that "Macbeth" was playing (= being performed) at the festival.
examples.cn: 我没想到《麦克白》正在艺术节上演。

examples.en: In the movie version, Branagh played the hero.
examples.cn: 在电影版中，布拉那扮演主人公。

longDef.en: to behave or pretend in a particular way, especially in order to produce a particular effect or result

examples.en: to play dead/dumb
examples.cn: 装死／哑巴

examples.en: Would you mind playing host (= entertaining the guests)?
examples.cn: 你来招待客人好吗？

longDef.en: to deceive someone to make them laugh or in order to get an advantage over them

examples.en: She loves playing practical jokes on her friends.
examples.cn: 她喜欢对她的朋友们搞恶作剧。

examples.en: When I saw the gun, my first thought was that he must be playing a joke.
He thought someone was trying to play a joke on him when he received the email.
One spring, his students played a trick on him by hiding his books.
Sometimes our nervous system can play nasty tricks on the body.

longDef.en: to help to achieve something

examples.en: My thanks to everyone who has played a part in saving the hospital.
examples.cn: 我向参与拯救这家医院的每一个人表示感谢。

examples.en: Better sanitation helped to eradicate malaria, but DDT also played a part.
The government wants us all to play a part in fighting terrorism.
Some of the people who will play a part in rebuilding the country are returning there for the first time in decades.

longDef.en: to perform music on an instrument or instruments
longDef.cn: 演奏，弹拨，吹奏（乐器）;播放

examples.en: He learned to play the clarinet at the age of ten.
examples.cn: 他10岁就开始学习吹奏单簧管。

examples.en: Play us a song!/Play a song for us!
examples.cn: 给我们奏支曲子吧！

examples.en: On Radio London they play African and South American music as well as rock and pop.
examples.cn: 伦敦广播电台不仅播放摇滚和流行音乐，还播放非洲和南美洲的音乐。

examples.en: They could hear a jazz band playing in the distance.
examples.cn: 他们可以听到远处的爵士乐队在演奏。

longDef.en: to (cause a machine to) produce sound or a picture

examples.en: Play the last few minutes of the video again.
examples.cn: 把录像带的最后几分钟再放一遍。

longDef.en: to direct or be directed over or onto something

examples.en: Firefighters played their hoses onto the base of the fire.
examples.cn: 消防队员把水龙头对准火源。

examples.en: A fountain was playing (= sending out water) in the courtyard outside.
examples.cn: 外面院子里有个喷泉在喷水。

longDef.en: (of something you see, such as light) to move quickly or be seen for a short time

examples.en: A smile played across/over/on his lips.
examples.cn: 他的唇角闪过一丝微笑。

longDef.en: to risk money, especially on the results of races or business deals, hoping to win more money

examples.en: He plays the horses/the stock market.
examples.cn: 他玩赌马／炒股。

longDef.en: a piece of writing that is intended to be acted in a theatre or on radio or television

examples.en: a radio play
examples.cn: 广播剧

examples.en: "Did you see the play (= the performance of the play) on Thursday?" "No, I went on Wednesday night."
examples.cn: “你星期四去看的那出戏吗？”“不，我星期三去的。”

longDef.en: the activity of taking part in a sport or a game

examples.en: Rain stopped play during the final of the National Tennis Championship.
examples.cn: 下雨使全国网球锦标赛的决赛中断了。

longDef.en: a plan or a small set of actions in a sport

examples.en: The new pitcher made a great play on that throw to first base.
examples.cn: 新投手向一垒投出了精彩的一球。

longDef.en: activity that is not serious but done for enjoyment, especially when children enjoy themselves with toys and games

examples.en: The kids don't get much time for play in the evenings.
examples.cn: 孩子们晚上没有多少时间玩。

examples.en: We watched the children at play in the park.
examples.cn: 我们看着公园里玩耍的孩子们。

longDef.en: movement

examples.en: the play of moonlight across the water
examples.cn: 水面上月光闪烁

examples.en: the play of emotion across/on his face
examples.cn: 他面部表情的变化

longDef.en: the fact that a rope or a structure is free to move, especially a small distance
longDef.cn: （尤指小幅度的）伸缩余地；间隙；活动空间

examples.en: Aircraft wings are designed to have a certain amount of play in them.
examples.cn: 飞机的机翼设计得有一定的弹性空间。
